data.title: VS Code Stable 1.9.0 - Extension does not get activated on Windows 7

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VS Code 1.9
2. Install PowerShell extension 0.9.0
3. Create or open a PowerShell file (.ps1)
4. Notice that the extension does not activate and no extension commands are able to be executed (try "PowerShell: Run Selection").

A couple PowerShell extension users have reported that on Windows 7 and VS Code 1.9 the PowerShell extension no longer becomes activated when opening a .ps1 file (see PowerShell/vscode-powershell#488).  I have not personally been able to reproduce this issue so I'm looking for some ideas on what we can use to debug the problem.  Any ideas?

Thanks!

/cc @DerfOh @emmdeeess

data.title: vscode.workspace.textDocuments call does not return hidden previewHtml documents
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Win10 and MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:
**Configuration to connect to SQL from the extension**
Reference: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19732 

**Repro steps - execute 2 separate queries**
Highlight the text `select * from sys.databases` and execute `MS SQL: Execute Query` (Ctrl+Shift+E) to run
You will notice the results editor tab opens, which is a WebView component.
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3318689/22663003/dec75a52-ec5f-11e6-8a25-0113d860230f.PNG)

Hide this webview behind the .sql document you just created:
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3318689/22663023/ef0e5fc8-ec5f-11e6-821a-6f83151ce2b1.PNG)

Highlight the text` select * from sys.tables` and execute the MS SQL: Execute Query

Expected:
The results editor tab is found, brought to the foreground, and refreshed. 

Actual:
The results editor tab is not found and not refreshed. A new results tab with the same URI is opened in the second pane. 
![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3318689/22663301/f5905ad0-ec60-11e6-8468-d5cb09587225.PNG)


Note that, if you have the results tab in the foreground, it is always found and refreshed properly. 
The reason this is not happening is because this slice of code tells us if there is one already open or not: 

```
    public doesResultPaneExist(resultsUri: string): boolean {
        let resultPaneURIMatch = vscode.workspace.textDocuments.find(tDoc => tDoc.uri.toString() === resultsUri);
        return (resultPaneURIMatch !== undefined);
    }
```
`vscode.workspace.textDocuments` contains all text documents, regardless of if they are visible or not, but it does not contain all previewHtml documents. It only contains the previewHtml documents that are visible. (In other words, any previewHtml documents which are not visible are not found in `vscode.workspace.textDocuments` which is inconsistent with other types of text documents)

data.title: VSCode default language extensions override custom language extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install [vscode-icons](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=robertohuertasm.vscode-icons)
2. Install [Vue language extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=liuji-jim.vue)
3. Create a new file with the `.vue` extension.
4. Instead of the `Vue icon` the `html icon` is shown.

`vscode-icons` provides support for `Vue` files by leveraging the language id but it seems that the mechanism that it's used by the icon theme API is giving priority to the default language extensions provided by `VSCode`. 

This has an unexpected behavior as **the users are not able to see the expected icon**. 

In the case of `Vue`, you can see where it is associated to `html` in `VSCode`'s code in the [html extension](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/html/package.json#L37) as @JimiC pointed out in  [vscode-icons #725](https://github.com/vscode-icons/vscode-icons/issues/725#issuecomment-277616047).

This is the only case where the file association has to be explicit, meaning that the [user has to explicitly change the file association](https://github.com/vscode-icons/vscode-icons/issues/725#issuecomment-277642688) so she can see the proper icon. That's not the case when the language id is not provided by default by `VSCode`.

This is clearly creating inconsistencies in the user experience thus confusing the users about what they are supposed to do. 

It would be nice if this could somehow be changed to prioritize custom language ids over default ones. This is at least what we were expecting from our side as icon theme builders until we've found out that this is not how it seems to be working.

data.title: Fix error markers and problems links in untitled js and ts files
data.body:
Fixes #19856

**Bug**
No error/warning markers shown in untitled js and ts files. 

Clicking on problem in problem view tried to jump to non-existent file

**Fix**
Add logic to handle files with an `untitled` scheme correctly

data.title: Enable Markdown Scroll Syncronization for Untitled Files
data.body:
Fixes #20070

**Bug**
Markdown scroll sync and other sync features do not work for untitled files. The root cause seems to be that the `main.js` markdown file is never loaded into the webview

**Fix**
Instead of a using a path without a scheme for `main.js`, use a `file://` path

data.title: Fix Markdown Scroll Sync For Windows Path Casing
data.body:
**Bug**
Scroll sync not working for some users on windows

**Fix**
Root cause seems to be that windows drive/path cases can sometimes differ between preview and editor document. Adds a equality check based on `fsPath` as well

Fixes #20000 
Fixes #19966
Fixes #19898
Fixes #19802

data.title: Don't open Untitled file when Welcome page is opened
Mapped SharePoint Doc Lib - "The TypeScript language service died unexpectedly 5 times in the last 5 Minutes."
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|Angular1|johnpapa|0.1.16|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.1.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  From Windows 10 client, map a network drive to a SharePoint 2013 document library   (NET USE Z: HTTP://PORTAL/SITES/TEST)
2. Change directory to (CD Z:\)
3.  Launch VSCode (CODE .)
4.  Error will appear "The TypeScript language service died unexpectedly 5 times in the last 5 Minutes."
5.  Screenshot here:
![2017-02-06_10-43-19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5648223/22656612/880e301a-ec59-11e6-9dc7-cbfb56bad956.png)


I suspect this has to do with the WebClient folder redirection over HTTP and potentially SharePoint blocked file types (JSON not allowed).    Ideally was looking for any way to suppress the TS error blinking very 3 seconds constantly.

Similar to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9215  but only occurs with a SharePoint mapped drive letter.  Local folders OK.

Thank you!


---UDPATE---

I performed a fresh new install and the issue no longer occurs.   This may have been caused by either (1) install VSCode over Chocolatey or (2) a NPM Global installed different typescript version.

1) Uninstalled VSCode from Control Panel
2) Deleted "npm" and "npm_cache" folders at "c:\Users\User\AppData\Roaming\"
3) Ran "cuninst visualstudiocode" to remove from Chocoately package manager
4) reboot
5) Install VSCode direct from website
6) Test and works OK now editing JS files from mapped SharePoint drive letter

data.title: Consider adding some more visible way of selecting a terminal shell

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Perhaps the + icon could open a quick pick or popup which presented:

- cmd
- powershell
- bash for windows
- git bash

These could be configured using some settings behind the scenes which knows about the paths to these since they will almost always be in the same spot. The setting could look something like this:

```js
"...shells": {
  "cmd": "%windir%\\sysnative\\cmd.exe",
  "PowerShell": "windir%\\sysnative\\WindowsPowerShell\\v1.0\\powershell.exe",
  "Bash on Windows": "%windir%\\sysnative\\bash.exe",
  "Git Bash": "%programfiles^\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe" // if it exists
}
```

Note that we don't want to run into the same issues as `commandsToSkipShell` https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19770 if we create such a setting.

data.title: Emmet multicursor snippets don't work as I remember them working
data.body:
From our Interactive Playground

ul>li.item$*5

I remember this snippet resulting in 5 cursors at the right spot (i.e. 5 multiple cursors). It now creates 5 different tab stops each consisting of one cursor. I'm not sure if this change is intentional or not.

data.title: Using tasks "_runner": "terminal" ignores "cwd"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add `"_runner": "terminal"` to `tasks.json` with `"cwd"` set
2. Run task

Example task that worked before adding the `_runner` setting:

```json
{
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "command": "npm",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "suppressTaskName": true,
  "options": {
    "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/scripts"
  },
  "args": ["run"],
  "tasks": [
    {
      "taskName": "Seed Database",
      "suppressTaskName": true,
      "showOutput": "always",
      "args": [
        "seed-database"
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

This executes as expected and runs `npm run seed-database` from inside the `./scripts` folder.

If you add:

```json
{
  "_runner": "terminal"
}
```

Then I get:

```sh
npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.14393
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "run" "seed-database"
npm ERR! node v6.9.1
npm ERR! npm  v3.10.8
npm ERR! path C:\dev\project\package.json
npm ERR! code ENOENT
npm ERR! errno -4058
npm ERR! syscall open

npm ERR! enoent ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:\dev\project\package.json'
npm ERR! enoent ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:\dev\project\package.json'
npm ERR! enoent This is most likely not a problem with npm itself
npm ERR! enoent and is related to npm not being able to find a file.
npm ERR! enoent

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     C:\dev\project\npm-debug.log
Press any key to close the terminal
```

We do not have a `package.json` in the `C:\dev\project` folder, but there is one in the `C:\dev\project\scripts` folder, where the task is supposed to be running.

data.title: Debugger should show unescaped strings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new .net core project with `dotnet new`
2. Specify the following main function:
```
        public static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            var test = @"{""Test"": 123}";
            Console.WriteLine(test);
        }
```
3) Put a break point on the last ending brace of the function
4) Debug

----> Observe the variables and watch window shows the value of the string as `"{\"Test\": 123}"` when it should show the unescaped value of `{"Test": 123}`.

This is important because I"m in the process of writing an application to read and write structured (json) logs and trying to verify some things with the debugger, and it's adding extra steps to verifying the json being output (since I have to manually unescape it in order to pretty print it for verification)

I have no idea if this is C# or VSCode specific.
